free_txt: N.O.
+ +  CORRECTED BY S.MAEV
.ERRORS STRUCTURE GIVEN IN RETRIEVABLE FORM
AND DATA-ERR CHANGED TO ERR-T
.SAMPLE AND ERROR UNFORMATION MOVED IN
PROPER SUBENTS
.MONITOR AND MONIT-REF INFORMATION
CORRECTED                              + +

bib_record.title: -NEUTRON CROSS SECTIONS OF TE-122, TE-123, AND TE-124 BETWEEN 1 AND 60 KEV.

free_txt: THE KARLSRUHE PULSED 3.7 MV VAN DE GRAAFF
ACCELERATOR. THE PULSE WIDTH WAS 0.7 NS, THE REPETI-
TION RATE WAS 1 MHZ, AND THE AVERAGE PROTON BEAM
CURRENT WAS 6 MICROAMPS.
.THE TOTAL CROSS SECTIONS WERE CORRECTED FOR A TIME-
DEPENDENT BACKGROUND.
.THE CAPTURE DATA WERE CORRECTED FOR THE VARIOUS TRANS-
MISSIONS THROUGH THE SAMPLES TO THE MONITOR. THE DATA
WERE FURTHER CORRECTED FOR BACKGROUND, MEASURED WITH
AN EMPTY SAMPLE FRAME, AND FOR SAMPLE-SCATTERED NEU-
TRONS, STUDIED WITH THE GRAPHITE SAMPLE. CORRECTIONS
WERE ALSO APPLIED FOR MULTIPLE SCATTERING, NEUTRON
SELF-SHIELDING, GAMMA-RAY SELF-SHIELDING, ISOTOPIC
IMPURITIES, AND DETECTOR EFFICIENCY.
THE CAPTURE EVENTS WERE DETECTED BY THREE
MOXON-RAE DETECTORS WITH DIFFERENT CONVERTERS. THEY
WERE POSITIONED 70 MM FROM THE SAMPLE AND AT AN ANGLE
OF 120 DEGREES WITH RESPECT TO THE PROTON BEAM.
BISMUTH, GRAPHITE AND A BISMUTH-GRAPHITE MIXTURE WERE
USED AS CONVERTERS. THE INTRINSIC TIME RESOLUTION WAS
600 PS, RESULTING IN AN OVERALL TIME RESOLUTION OF
BETTER THAN 1 NS IN THE TIME-OF-FLIGHT SPECTRA.
A LI-6 GLASS DETECTOR, LOCATED AT 0 DEGREES AND
AT 26 CM DOWNSTREAM OF THE NEUTRON TARGET, WAS USED TO
MONITOR THE NEUTRON SPECTRA. IT WAS ALSO USED FOR THE
TOTAL CROSS SECTION MEASUREMENTS.
GAMMA-RAY SELF-ABSORPTION ERROR
BEAM INTENSITY ERROR
THE KARLSRUHE PULSED 3.7 MV VAN DE GRAAFF
ACCELERATOR. THE PULSE WIDTH WAS 0.7 NS, THE REPETI-
TION RATE WAS 1 MHZ, AND THE AVERAGE PROTON BEAM
CURRENT WAS 6 MICROAMPS.
NEUTRONS WERE PRODUCED BY BOMBARDING A 0.5
MG/CM2 METALLIC LITHIUM TARGET ON A 0.2 MM THICK
COPPER BACKING. THE PROTON ENERGY WAS 1.912 MEV.
THE NEUTRON FLUX AT THE SAMPLE POSITION WAS 3.0E+07
NEUTRONS/SEC.
.A CONTINUOUS NEUTRON SPECTRUM WITH A MAXIMUM ENERGY
OF AROUND 106 KEV. THE NEUTRONS WERE KINEMATICALLY
COLLIMATED WITHIN A CONE OF 120 DEGREES OPENING ANGLE.
THE NEUTRON ENERGIES WERE DETERMINED WITH TIME-
OF-FLIGHT TECHNIQUES.
IN-BEAM GAMMA-RAY SPECTROSCOPY.
THE STANDARD GOLD CAPTURE
CROSS SECTION AS A FUNCTION OF ENERGY WAS TAKEN FROM
MACKLIN, AND
NORMALIZED TO THE MORE
PRECISE CROSS SECTION DATA POINT AT KT = 25 KEV FROM
RATYNSKI AND KAEPPELER.
.A 368.7 MG METAL GOLD SAMPLE, 0.25 MM THICK, WAS USED
FOR MEASURING THE NEUTRON FLUX.
.THE BACKGROUND WAS DETERMINED BY MEASUREMENTS WITHOUT
SAMPLE, AND WITH A 87.3 MG GRAPHITE SAMPLE, 0.6 MM
THICK, FOR THE STUDY OF SCATTERING EFFECTS.
.DATA TAKEN FROM MAIN REF.
.THE TELLURIUM SAMPLES WAS METALLIC TABLET OF 10 MM
DIAMETER, THICKNESSES 1 AND 2.4 MM, MASS 1059.1 AND
ISOTOPIC COMPOSITIONS WAS  AS FOLLOWS
TE-122 91.86 PERCENT, TE-123 0.61 PERCENT,
TE-124  1.77 PERCENT, TE-125 0.78 PERCENT,
TE-126  1.58 PERCENT, TE-128 1.698PERCENT,
TE-130  1.42 PERCENT
THE SAMPLES WERE PARTLY OXYDIZED, WITH CONTRIBUTIONS
OF 0.7, WEIGHT FOR TE-122
.THE SAMPLES WERE CENTERED BETWEEN TWO THIN KAPTON
FOILS, 1 MG/CM2, IN A SAMPLE CHANGER. IN THE THREE
RUNS THE SAMPLES WERE CYCLICALLY MOVED TO THE MEA-
SURING POSITION, 20+/-0.1 MM FROM THE NEUTRON TARGET.
THE MEASURING TIMES OF ABOUT 10 MINUTES WAS CONTROLLED
BY A BEAM CURRENT INTEGRATOR. EACH OF THE THREE RUNS
WAS ABOUT 200 HRS.
.DATA TAKEN FROM TABLE II OF MAIN REF.
.THE TELLURIUM SAMPLE WAS METALLIC TABLET OF 10 MM
DIAMETER AND WITH THICKNESS 1.25 MM, MASS 418.4 MG,
ISOTOPIC COMPOSITIONS WAS AS FOLLOWS
TE-122  0.48  PERCENT, TE-123 89.58  PERCENT,
TE-124  1.52  PERCENT, TE-125  1.24  PERCENT,
TE-126  2.68  PERCENT, TE-128  2.51  PERCENT,
TE-130  1.99  PERCENT
THE SAMPLES WERE PARTLY OXYDIZED, WITH CONTRIBUTIONS
OF 12.1 PERCENT BY WEIGHT FOR TE-123 SAMPLE
.THE BACKGROUND WAS DETERMINED BY MEASUREMENTS WITHOUT
SAMPLE, AND WITH A 87.3 MG GRAPHITE SAMPLE, 0.6 MM
THICK, FOR THE STUDY OF SCATTERING EFFECTS.
.THE SAMPLES WERE CENTERED BETWEEN TWO THIN KAPTON
FOILS, 1 MG/CM2, IN A SAMPLE CHANGER. IN THE THREE
RUNS THE SAMPLES WERE CYCLICALLY MOVED TO THE MEA-
SURING POSITION, 20+/-0.1 MM FROM THE NEUTRON TARGET.
THE MEASURING TIMES OF ABOUT 10 MINUTES WAS CONTROLLED
BY A BEAM CURRENT INTEGRATOR. EACH OF THE THREE RUNS
WAS ABOUT 200 HRS.
.DATA TAKEN FROM TABLE II OF MAIN REF.
.THE TELLURIUM SAMPLES WAS METALLIC TABLET OF 10 MM
DIAMETER AND WITH THICKNESS 1.0 MM, MASS 464.5 MG
ISOTOPIC COMPOSITIONS WAS AS FOLLOWS
TE-122   0.2 PERCENT, TE-123   0.1 PERCENT,
TE-124 92.61 PERCENT, TE-125  4.03 PERCENT,
TE-126  1.55 PERCENT, TE-128  1.07 PERCENT,
TE-130  0.74 PERCENT
THE SAMPLES WERE PARTLY OXYDIZED, WITH CONTRIBUTIONS
OF 1.0 PERCENT BY WEIGHT FOR TE-124
.THE BACKGROUND WAS DETERMINED BY MEASUREMENTS WITHOUT

.THE SAMPLES WERE CENTERED BETWEEN TWO THIN KAPTON

RUNS THE SAMPLES WERE CYCLICALLY MOVED TO THE MEA-
SURING POSITION, 20+/-0.1 MM FROM THE NEUTRON TARGET.
THE MEASURING TIMES OF ABOUT 10 MINUTES WAS CONTROLLED
BY A BEAM CURRENT INTEGRATOR. EACH OF THE THREE RUNS
WAS ABOUT 200 HRS.
.DATA TAKEN FROM TABLE II OF MAIN REF.
TOTAL ERROR ON CROSS SECTIONS. FOR THE CAP-
TURE DATA, THESE WERE OBTAINED BY ADDING THE TOTAL
ERROR OF THE CROSS-SECTION RATIO TO GOLD WITH 1.5
PERCENT IN QUADRATURE, TO TAKE INTO ACCOUNT THE UN-
CERTAINTY OF THE GOLD CROSS SECTION.
